docs.text: Welcome to MkDocs For full documentation visit mkdocs.org . Commands mkdocs new [dir-name] - Create a new project. mkdocs serve - Start the live-reloading docs server. mkdocs build - Build the documentation site. mkdocs help - Print this help message. Project layout mkdocs.yml # The configuration file. docs/ index.md # The documentation homepage. ... # Other markdown pages, images and other files. More Help Material Design https://squidfunk.github.io/mkdocs-material/getting-started/

docs.text: Create SSL certificate for Jenkins private key and cert-file to .p12 file .\openssl pkcs12 -export -out server.p12 -inkey server.key -in server.crt // Set some password! create java keystore and store the .p12 certificate in it cd "C:\Program Files (x86)\Jenkins\jre\bin" .\keytool -importkeystore -srckeystore "C:\Program Files (x86)\Jenkins\ssl_ce rtificate\vm-scripting.p12" -srcstoretype pkcs12 -destkeystore "C:\Program Files (x86)\Jenkins\ssl_certificate\Jenkins.j ks" -deststoretype JK
docs.title: Create ssl certificate

docs.text: .\openssl pkcs12 -export -out server.p12 -inkey server.key -in server.crt // Set some password!
docs.title: private key and cert-file to .p12 file

docs.text: cd "C:\Program Files (x86)\Jenkins\jre\bin" .\keytool -importkeystore -srckeystore "C:\Program Files (x86)\Jenkins\ssl_ce rtificate\vm-scripting.p12" -srcstoretype pkcs12 -destkeystore "C:\Program Files (x86)\Jenkins\ssl_certificate\Jenkins.j ks" -deststoretype JK
docs.title: create java keystore and store the .p12 certificate in it

docs.text: Error creating bean with name 'authenticationManager': Cannot resolve reference to bean 'activeDirectory' while setting bean property 'providers' Stopped the Jenkins service, and unregistered and registered the service using the following in an administrative command prompt: cd \ Program Files ( x86 )\ Jenkins net stop jenkins jenkins uninstall jenkins install net start jenkins
docs.title: error_authenticationmanager

docs.text: Stopped the Jenkins service, and unregistered and registered the service using the following in an administrative command prompt: cd \ Program Files ( x86 )\ Jenkins net stop jenkins jenkins uninstall jenkins install net start jenkins
docs.title: Error creating bean with name 'authenticationManager': Cannot resolve reference to bean 'activeDirectory' while setting bean property 'providers'

docs.text: Outlook keeps prompting for password 1. Method Quote Managed to resolve this issue now. In the newest version of Office 2016, it looks for Autodiscover records at 365 first, before trying to use SCR etc. Older versions try to use SCP and HTTP methods, but now 365 is the default. This can be disabled With this reg key, which stops Outlook from trying to poll 365 autodiscover records first. [HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Microsoft\Office\16.O\Outlook\AutoDiscover] "ExcludeExplicitO365Endpoint"=dword:00000001 Info This will probably not apply if you use 365 for your Exchange. We use on-prem Exchange 2010.
docs.title: keeps prompting for password

docs.text: Quote Managed to resolve this issue now. In the newest version of Office 2016, it looks for Autodiscover records at 365 first, before trying to use SCR etc. Older versions try to use SCP and HTTP methods, but now 365 is the default. This can be disabled With this reg key, which stops Outlook from trying to poll 365 autodiscover records first. [HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Microsoft\Office\16.O\Outlook\AutoDiscover] "ExcludeExplicitO365Endpoint"=dword:00000001 Info This will probably not apply if you use 365 for your Exchange. We use on-prem Exchange 2010.
docs.title: 1. Method

docs.text: bypass certificate validiation Error when using these cmdlets or these messages appear: TLS/SSL secure channel error Import-Module Invoke-"Commands" The request was aborted: Could not create SSL/TLS secure channel. Solution if ( -not ( [System.Management.Automation.PSTypeName] 'ServerCertificateValidationCallback' ). Type ) { $certCallback = @" using System; using System.Net; using System.Net.Security; using System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates; public class ServerCertificateValidationCallback { public static void Ignore() { if(ServicePointManager.ServerCertificateValidationCallback ==null) { ServicePointManager.ServerCertificateValidationCallback += delegate ( Object obj, X509Certificate certificate, X509Chain chain, SslPolicyErrors errors ) { return true; }; } } } "@ Add-Type $certCallback } [ServerCertificateValidationCallback] :: Ignore ()
docs.title: bypass-certifcate-validation

docs.text: TLS/SSL secure channel error Import-Module Invoke-"Commands" The request was aborted: Could not create SSL/TLS secure channel.
docs.title: Error when using these cmdlets or these messages appear:

docs.text: if ( -not ( [System.Management.Automation.PSTypeName] 'ServerCertificateValidationCallback' ). Type ) { $certCallback = @" using System; using System.Net; using System.Net.Security; using System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates; public class ServerCertificateValidationCallback { public static void Ignore() { if(ServicePointManager.ServerCertificateValidationCallback ==null) { ServicePointManager.ServerCertificateValidationCallback += delegate ( Object obj, X509Certificate certificate, X509Chain chain, SslPolicyErrors errors ) { return true; }; } } } "@ Add-Type $certCallback } [ServerCertificateValidationCallback] :: Ignore ()
docs.title: Solution
